Implementation

User authentication

We use Django build in Admin framework and authentication methods to implement our website. We add Users and User group in admin website allowing access to our website.

A UserView class is created as a base class of other Views. It is restricted to django LoginRequiredMixin which mean user has to login to gain access to this view.

At admin.py we register model datas that can be modified in admin site.

Database and connection to front end

We use SQLite database and its connected to django frame work by setting Database configuration at mysite/setting.py
We set up data strucures at website/model.py using model build in method.
Below is a example , a patient data model has PAS_number,name and etc attributes. Models.ForeignKey serves as a link to a different data model.

Data models are imported and used in Views

Functionality Implementation

Display timetable

We automatically fetches username and firstname for logged in user by letting RotaView inherits UserView class.
We receive selected date for display at get()using Datetimepicker implemented as a django form. If no date is selected, current date will be displayed. We sort appointments that is booked in selected date and belongs to logged in ocularist as a list using django built in function Object.all.filter(desired-property). Appointments that has been canceled will be excluded in the list. If weekly rota is requested,generate_weekly_rota function is called otherwise generate_day_rota will be called. The SLOTS dictonary stores appointment type and its corresponding appointment time duration(number of slots needed to complete appointments). Ocularists only need to fill in appointment start time when booking and the duration will be calculated here. The DAY_ROTA is a dictonary with fixed time slots in timetable as dictonary key. Value are set to None as default. Sorted appointments and its corresponding time slots will be stored in tmp_rota for use in htmls.
